items.sentence: Tom said he was glad you did that for Mary.
Tom says he'd like to do that this evening.
Tom says he does that several times a week.
Tom said that he wished Mary would do that.
Tom said that he wished Mary could do that.
Tom said that he thought you would do that.
Tom said that he thought you could do that.
Tom said that he thought he should do that.
Tom said that he thought he had to do that.
Tom said that he thinks Mary won't do that.
Tom said that he thinks Mary can't do that.
Tom said that he knew you wouldn't do that.
Tom said that he knew you couldn't do that.
Tom said that he hopes that you'll do that.
Tom said that he hopes you like to do that.
You think I'd refuse to do that, don't you?
You won't be able to get out of doing that.
There's no doubt that Tom hasn't done that.
Shall we get up early tomorrow and do that?
I was kind of hoping that we could do that.
It was raining when Tom did that yesterday.
If the weather's bad, please don't do that.
It would probably be better not to do that.
I seriously doubt we'll be able to do that.
Tom is still not allowed to do that, is he?
I thought you and I could do that together.
Maybe you and I can do that together again.
You aren't under any obligation to do that.
I wanted Tom to know that I didn't do that.
I know I might not have to do that anymore.
I knew I might not have to do that anymore.
I didn't think you'd be tempted to do that.
I can't believe that you agreed to do that.
I'm sure Tom won't be motivated to do that.
I'm sure Tom will be determined to do that.
I'm not as determined to do that as Tom is.
I did that out of the goodness of my heart.
I'd do that if I had more time on my hands.
You did that against your will, didn't you?
I'm not as motivated to do that as you are.
I'd be permitted to do that if I wanted to.
I think that doing that would be a mistake.
You may do that anywhere you want to do it.
I asked Tom if he really needed to do that.
I assured Tom that I'd never do that again.
Do you have an air conditioner in your car?
There's a little water left in the pitcher.
Tom saw Mary throw something into the fire.
Let's meet at 2:30 in front of Tom's house.
Who's this Tom you're always talking about?
